text:
By setting higher standards, we can unlock our brain’s powerful search engine. 🧠

If we just look for “a good opportunity,” we’ll drown in options. Instead, let’s do a focused search and ask three key questions: “What inspires me deeply?” “What am I really good at?” and “What’s a big need in the world?” Sure, there won’t be as many options, but that’s the point. We’re not hunting for a bunch of decent things to do. We want to find our best contribution: the right thing, the right way, at the right time.

Essentialists spend tons of time exploring, listening, debating, questioning, and thinking. But this exploration isn’t just for fun. It’s about figuring out the vital few things that matter most from the trivial many. ✨

STEP 2. ELIMINATE:

**PAGE SUMMARY:** By applying tougher criteria and asking specific questions, we can focus on identifying our highest level of contribution rather than being overwhelmed by numerous good opportunities.
